text: Lee County is a county found in the U.S. state of Mississippi. As of the 2020 census, 83,343 people lived there. Its county seat is Tupelo. == History == Lee County was founded on October 26, 1866, and named for Robert E. Lee. == Geography == According to the U.S. Census Bureau, the county has a total area of , of which is land and (0.7%) is water. === Bordering counties === * Prentiss County (north) * Itawamba County (east) * Monroe County (southeast) * Chickasaw County (southwest) * Pontotoc County (west) * Union County (northwest) == Communities == === Cities === * Baldwyn (partly in Prentiss County) * Saltillo * Tupelo (county seat) * Verona === Towns === * Barrett Ridge * Guntown * Nettleton (partly in Monroe County) * Plantersville * Shannon * Sherman (partly in Pontotoc County and Union County) === Census- designated places === * Mooreville === Unincorporated communities === * Belden * Brewer * Eggville * Ellistown * Jug Fork == References == == Other websites == * Official county website Category:19th-century establishments in Mississippi Category:1866 establishments in the United States
title: Lee County, Mississippi
